title: § 6-1-1701(9) — High-risk AI systems (employment)
excerpt: High-risk artificial intelligence system means any artificial intelligence system that, when deployed, makes, or is a substantial factor in making, a consequential decision. A consequential decision is a decision that has a material legal or similarly significant effect on the provision or denial of employment, including recruitment or selection...

title: § 6-1-1703 — Deployer obligations (risk management)
excerpt: A deployer shall use reasonable care to protect consumers from any known or reasonably foreseeable risks of algorithmic discrimination arising from the deployer's intended and contracted uses of the high-risk artificial intelligence system. A deployer shall implement a risk management policy and program...

title: § 6-1-1703(2) — Impact assessment
excerpt: A deployer shall complete an impact assessment for each high-risk artificial intelligence system prior to deploying the system. The impact assessment must document the purpose and intended uses; the beneficiaries; the type of data processed; known or reasonably foreseeable risks of algorithmic discrimination...

title: § 6-1-1703(3) — Data governance
excerpt: Deployers shall implement data governance measures appropriate to the intended use of the high-risk AI system, including data minimization, quality assurance, and retention policies...

title: § 6-1-1703(4) — Human oversight
excerpt: Deployers shall ensure meaningful human review before relying on the output of a high-risk AI system to make or be a substantial factor in making a consequential decision, where technically feasible...

title: § 6-1-1702 — Developer obligations (testing)
excerpt: Developers shall use reasonable care to protect consumers from known or reasonably foreseeable risks of algorithmic discrimination, including appropriate testing and validation procedures...

title: § 6-1-1704 — Consumer disclosures
excerpt: Any entity that deploys, offers, or makes available an AI system intended to interact with consumers must disclose this to the consumer unless it would be obvious to a reasonable person. Deployers must provide consumers with a statement of reasons, opportunity to correct, and right to appeal when adverse decisions are made...

title: § 6-1-1703(8) — Post-deployment monitoring
excerpt: Deployers shall establish procedures for ongoing monitoring and testing to identify and address algorithmic discrimination that may arise during deployment...
